name: G√©n√©rer des briefings d'action hebdomadaires sur les droits des animaux √† partir des projets de loi de la Chambre des √âtats-Unis avec Gemini AI
description:
## üêæ √Ä qui cela s'adresse-t-il

Aux d√©fenseurs des animaux et aux militants qui souhaitent un **bref hebdomadaire sur les projets de loi li√©s aux animaux** avec des √©tapes claires et exploitables‚Äîaucune recherche manuelle n√©cessaire.

## ‚è± Ce que cela fait

Chaque lundi √† 8h, ce flux de travail :

1. **R√©cup√®re tous les projets de loi de la Chambre** pr√©vus pour la semaine.
2. **Nettoie et t√©l√©charge les PDF des projets de loi.**
3. **Analyse chaque projet de loi avec Gemini** (pertinence, urgence, position, points d'action cl√©s).
4. **Filtre les projets de loi non pertinents** en utilisant des seuils int√©gr√©s.
5. **Ex√©cute un sous-flux de recherche** pour le lobbying, le parrainage et les informations sur les coalitions.
6. **G√©n√®re un e-mail d'action HTML pr√™t √† √™tre envoy√©** avec des scripts, des contacts et des d√©lais.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Comment configurer

1. **Importez ce flux de travail** dans n8n.
2. **T√©l√©chargez et importez** le [Sous-flux de recherche](https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/) et s√©lectionnez-le dans le n≈ìud ‚ÄúRecherche‚Äù.
3. **Ajoutez les identifiants de messagerie** (SMTP, Gmail, etc.) dans le n≈ìud Email.
4. (Optionnel) **Ajustez l'invite de Gemini ou les seuils** selon vos priorit√©s.

## üîë Exigences

* **Cl√© API Gemini** (via Google AI Studio ou Vertex AI).
* **Identifiants du fournisseur de messagerie**.
* **Sous-flux de recherche** (li√© ci-dessus).

## üéõ Comment personnaliser

* **Modifiez l'invite de Gemini** pour vous concentrer sur des probl√®mes sp√©cifiques (par exemple, la faune, les animaux d'√©levage).
* **Changez les seuils de pertinence/urgence** pour inclure plus ou moins de projets de loi.
* **Ajustez le design de l'e-mail HTML** ou le style de l'appel √† l'action.

workflow.name: Generate weekly animal-rights action briefings from U.S. House bills

options.systemPromptTemplate:
You are an expert extraction algorithm.
Only extract relevant information from the text.
If you do not know the value of an attribute asked to extract, you may omit the attribute's value.

Do not include ```json, begin your response with the opening curly bracket, no backticks or code blocks

parameters.content:
**Weekly Scheduler**  
- **Runs:** Every Monday at 8 AM.  
- **Purpose:** Starts the automation to fetch all bills on the House floor for the upcoming week.

value.chatInput:
=You are a research assistant specialized in US legislation and advocacy. Given the summary of the following legislative bill(s) related to animal welfare, dig deeper to uncover additional relevant information including:

    Names of bill sponsors and cosponsors, including their committee assignments and political affiliations

    Key lobbying groups or corporations supporting or opposing the bill, with details on their interests and past influence

    Advocacy organizations actively campaigning for or against the bill, including grassroots movements and national nonprofits

    Historical or related legislation context, such as previous versions of the bill, amendments, or connected policies

    Public sentiment indicators such as recent news headlines, editorials, social media trends, and relevant public statements by officials

    Contact information for relevant decision-makers, including committee chairs, bill sponsors, and influential legislators

    Key dates and upcoming milestones related to the bill‚Äôs progress (e.g., scheduled hearings, votes)

    Potential political or industry pressures that may impact the bill‚Äôs trajectory

    Data on related public petitions, endorsements, or opposition campaigns

    Relevant regulatory or agency actions tied to the bill‚Äôs subject matter

Provide concise, actionable insights that activists can use to tailor their outreach and advocacy efforts effectively.

# BILLS TO RESEARCH

{{ JSON.stringify($json.data) }}

parameters.text:
=You are an expert email content writer creating a high‚Äëimpact, easy‚Äëto‚Äëscan HTML briefing for animal rights activists, covering **all relevant bills on the House floor this week**.

**Your goal is to help activists win last‚Äëminute legislative fights** by giving them exactly what they need to act quickly, persuasively, and effectively‚Äîwithout inventing any details not present in the data.

### Requirements for the Email:

1. **Subject line:**

   * Conveys overall urgency and key ‚Äúask‚Äù (e.g., ‚ÄúURGENT: Top 3 Animal Welfare Bills This Week ‚Äì Take Action Now!‚Äù).

2. **Top ‚ÄúAction Dashboard‚Äù (above the fold):**

   * **Ranked list of the top 3‚Äì5 bills** by `action_priority`.
   * For each bill, include:

     * **Bill title** (heading)
     * **Immediate ‚ÄúAsk‚Äù** (e.g., ‚ÄúOppose H.R. 1917 by Tuesday EOD‚Äù)
     * **Visual urgency bar or badge**
     * **One‚Äësentence reason why it matters** (focused on animal rights)

3. **Detailed Bill Sections (in priority order):**
   For **each bill**, include:

   * **Heading:** Bill title + urgency badge
   * **Recommended stance** (‚ÄúOppose,‚Äù ‚ÄúSupport,‚Äù or ‚ÄúMonitor‚Äù)
   * **Concise summary** (2‚Äì3 sentences, animal‚Äërights focus, using only provided data)
   * **Key action points:**

     * Bullet list of what to say or do (based strictly on provided `weeklyBills` data)
     * Pre‚Äëwritten **email/phone script snippets**
     * Suggested **social media text & hashtags**
   * **Contacts & Targets:**

     * Sponsor and committee chair (names and provided contact info)
     * Key swing votes (if available in data)
   * **Research intel highlights:**

     * Top lobbyists, counterarguments, advocacy coalitions (only if provided in data)
   * **Deadline & Next Steps:**

     * Date/time of vote or hearing
     * Clear ‚ÄúWhat to do by when‚Äù in bold

4. **Resources & Tools:**

   * Links or templates (letters, petitions, graphics) **only if provided** in the data.
   * Clear follow‚Äëup instructions (e.g., ‚ÄúCall again if no response‚Äù).

5. **Closing Call to Action:**

   * Brief motivational note, e.g., ‚ÄúYour calls can make the difference on these votes this week.‚Äù
   * **No mentions of fictional campaign hubs or Slack groups** unless explicitly included in the data.

**Format:**
Use clean, well‚Äëstructured HTML. Headings, bold text, and color‚Äëcoded urgency badges must make the email scannable. Include clickable links if they are present in the data.

---

**CONTEXT/INPUT:**

```
{{ $json.output }}

{{ JSON.stringify($('Aggregate').item.json.data) }}
```

parameters.content:
**Bill Fetching & PDF Parsing**  
- Downloads the list of bills for the week.  
- Extracts PDF links for full text of bills.  
- Passes each PDF to the Gemini analysis node.  
- **Tip:** If following bills from another source, update the fetch URLs and parsing logic.

**AI Bill Analysis (Gemini)**  
- **What it does:** Reads each bill PDF and analyzes it ** from an animal rights perspective.**  
- **Output Schema:**  
  - `bill_title` ‚Äì Title or short identifier of the bill.  
  - `summary` ‚Äì 2‚Äì3 sentence plain-language summary with critical animal rights analysis.  
  - `animal_welfare_score` ‚Äì 0 to 1 (0 = extremely harmful, 1 = strongly protective).  
  - `relevance_score` ‚Äì 0 to 1 (0 = unrelated to animals, 1 = entirely animal-focused).  
  - `action_priority` ‚Äì 0 to 1 (0 = no action needed, 1 = critical and urgent action).  
  - `stance` ‚Äì "support," "oppose," or "monitor."  
  - `key_points_for_action` ‚Äì Key talking points for activist campaigns.

- **User Control:**  
  - You can **edit the prompt text** in the Gemini node to change analysis preferences (e.g., emphasize wildlife habitat, climate effects, or only farmed animals).  
  - Adjusting the tone or priorities here will **directly change how scores like `action_priority` are set.**

**Bill Filtering**  
- Filters bills based on **relevance** and **urgency thresholds**.  
- **User Control:** Adjust thresholds to make the filter stricter (fewer, more critical bills) or looser (more bills included).

**Email Writer**  
- Generates a complete HTML briefing email using all aggregated data.  
- Uses a structured template with Action Dashboard, bill details, and call-to-action sections.  
- **Tip:** Update the template prompt if you want different formatting or tone (e.g., shorter summaries).

**Email Dispatch**  
- Sends the final email to your activist mailing list.  
- **Tip:** Update recipient settings or connect to another email provider node as needed.

**Research & Intel Gathering**  
- This step enriches each bill with extra research: sponsor details, lobbying activity, advocacy coalitions, and relevant media intel (if available).  
- **Required Setup:**  
  - **Download and set up the following subworkflow first:**  
    [Multi-Tool Research Agent for Animal Advocacy](https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/).  
  - After importing it, **select it as the Subworkflow** for this node.  
- **Tip:** You can customize the subworkflow to add/remove research sources or adjust the type of intel gathered.

**Bill Link Cleanup & PDF Download**  
- **What it does:**  
  1. Uses AI to clean and normalize the PDF links extracted from the bill list (removes duplicates, invalid URLs, or irrelevant links).  
  2. **Splits each bill link into a separate item** so that each bill can be analyzed individually in the workflow.  
  3. Downloads the PDF files for each bill to pass them to Gemini for analysis.

user.name: Open Paws
user.bio:
Open Paws is a nonprofit building open-source AI tools to accelerate animal advocacy. 

We create machine learning models and automation workflows trained on real-world campaign data to help end industrial animal exploitation. 

All tools are free, transparent, and designed for real-world impact.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.
